markdown:
Also called a hamadryad, a dryad queen rules over an entire forest, or a portion of an incredibly large forest, leading and protecting all dryads within. Dryad queens often have strange relationships with powerful and deadly fey, working together in a dualistic way despite their differences, with the queen representing nature's wonders and the other fey representing nature's wrath. **[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 33 **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 33 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28 [Dryad Queen](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3114) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 247 1.1 **Perception** +25; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +19, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +23, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +30, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +30, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +27, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +24, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +28, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +24 **Str** +2 **Dex** +6 **Con** +6 **Int** +4 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +8 **Nature Empathy** The dryad queen can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) skill with [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=531) and [plants](/Traits.aspx?ID=668).
**Tied to the Land** The dryad queen is tied to a forest or other woodland. --- **AC** 35 **Fort** +24 **Ref** +26 **Will** +24 **HP** 220 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10 **Nymph's Beauty** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=631), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=727)) DC 30. On a failed save, the target is [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) in awe for 1 minute. --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** branch +27 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d12+8 bludgeoning **Ranged** leaves +27 ([Plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d8+6 slashing **Primal Prepared Spells** DC 35, attack +25 - **Cantrips (7th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Frostbite](/Spells.aspx?ID=1539), [Guidance](/Spells.aspx?ID=142), [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171), [Stabilize](/Spells.aspx?ID=307) - **1st** [Fleet Step](/Spells.aspx?ID=122), [Gust of Wind](/Spells.aspx?ID=143), [Pest Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=217) - **2nd** [Animal Messenger](/Spells.aspx?ID=11), [Remove Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=252), [Revealing Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=1653) - **3rd** [Earthbind](/Spells.aspx?ID=94), [Haste](/Spells.aspx?ID=147), [Wall of Thorns](/Spells.aspx?ID=366) - **4th** [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125), [Mountain Resilience](/Spells.aspx?ID=1610), [Resist Energy](/Spells.aspx?ID=256) - **5th** [Banishment](/Spells.aspx?ID=19), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148), [Howling Blizzard](/Spells.aspx?ID=1559) - **6th** [Chain Lightning](/Spells.aspx?ID=33), [Cursed Metamorphosis](/Spells.aspx?ID=1479), [Tangling Creepers](/Spells.aspx?ID=331) - **7th** [Regenerate](/Spells.aspx?ID=248), [Summon Plant or Fungus](/Spells.aspx?ID=325) **Primal Innate Spells** DC 35, attack +25 - **Cantrips (5th)** [Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713) - **4th** [Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (at will), [Entangling Flora](/Spells.aspx?ID=1515) (at will), [Shape Wood](/Spells.aspx?ID=277) (at will), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) (at will) - **5th** [Nature's Pathway](/Spells.aspx?ID=1613) (×3), [One with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618) (at will) - **8th** [Impaling Briars](/Spells.aspx?ID=475) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Focus Beauty** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the dryad queen's beauty, the target can't use [hostile actions](/Rules.aspx?ID=300) against the dryad queen for 1 hour. **Inspiration** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Tree Meld** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) A [_one with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618) spell cast by a dryad queen has an unlimited duration. In addition, if the dryad merges with a tree in her domain, she can choose to instead enter an extradimensional living space within the tree, and can bring up to eight adjacent, willing creatures with her; the spell gains the [extradimensional](/Traits.aspx?ID=596) trait. The dryad queen can still be expelled from this space.
name: Dryad Queen

summary_markdown: Also called a hamadryad, a dryad queen rules over an entire forest, or a portion of an incredibly large forest, leading and protecting all dryads …
text: Dryad Queen Also called a hamadryad, a dryad queen rules over an entire forest, or a portion of an incredibly large forest, leading and protecting all dryads within. Dryad queens often have strange relationships with powerful and deadly fey, working together in a dualistic way despite their differences, with the queen representing nature's wonders and the other fey representing nature's wrath. Recall Knowledge - Fey (Nature): DC 33 Recall Knowledge - Plant (Nature): DC 33 Unspecific Lore : DC 31 Specific Lore : DC 28 Dryad Queen Source Monster Core pg. 247 1.1 Perception +25; low-light vision Languages Common, Elven, Fey, Muan Skills Acrobatics +25, Athletics +19, Crafting +23, Deception +30, Diplomacy +30, Intimidation +27, Nature +24, Performance +28, Stealth +25, Survival +24 Str +2 Dex +6 Con +6 Int +4 Wis +4 Cha +8 Nature Empathy The dryad queen can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals and plants. Tied to the Land The dryad queen is tied to a forest or other woodland. --- AC 35 Fort +24 Ref +26 Will +24 HP 220 Weaknesses cold iron 10, fire 10 Nymph's Beauty (aura, emotion, incapacitation, mental, primal, visual) DC 30. On a failed save, the target is immobilized in awe for 1 minute. --- Speed 30 feet Melee Single Action branch +27 (Finesse, Magical), Damage 3d12+8 bludgeoning Ranged Single Action leaves +27 (Plant, Primal, range increment 60 feet), Damage 3d8+6 slashing Primal Prepared Spells DC 35, attack +25 - Cantrips (7th) Detect Magic, Frostbite, Guidance, Light, Stabilize - 1st Fleet Step, Gust of Wind, Pest Form - 2nd Animal Messenger, Remove Fear, Revealing Light - 3rd Earthbind, Haste, Wall of Thorns - 4th Fly, Mountain Resilience, Resist Energy - 5th Banishment, Heal, Howling Blizzard - 6th Chain Lightning, Cursed Metamorphosis, Tangling Creepers - 7th Regenerate, Summon Plant or Fungus Primal Innate Spells DC 35, attack +25 - Cantrips (5th) Tangle Vine - 4th Charm (at will), Entangling Flora (at will), Shape Wood (at will), Suggestion (at will) - 5th Nature's Pathway (×3), One with Plants (at will) - 8th Impaling Briars Change Shape Single Action (Primal) Focus Beauty Single Action (Emotion, Incapacitation, Mental, Primal, Visual) On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the dryad queen's beauty, the target can't use hostile actions against the dryad queen for 1 hour. Inspiration Three Actions (Emotion, Mental, Primal) Tree Meld Two Actions (Primal) A one with plants spell cast by a dryad queen has an unlimited duration. In addition, if the dryad merges with a tree in her domain, she can choose to instead enter an extradimensional living space within the tree, and can bring up to eight adjacent, willing creatures with her; the spell gains the extradimensional trait. The dryad queen can still be expelled from this space.
